page.title: 13BROMLEY FOOTBALL CLUB
page.content: The club was founded in 1892. Their nickname is the Lilywhites. They have won the Amateur Cup three times, the London Senior Cup three times, the Kent Senior cup twice, the Kent Amateur Cup twelve times, the Athenian League three times and the Isthmian League four times. In the season 1923-4 Bromley won the Athenian League with 37 points. Three Bromley players have won England caps: Eric Fright, Cyril Martin and Tommy Hooper. I saw the 1982-3 team and they played well but lost 5-2. I also saw the reserves play; they drew 1-1. Bromley are in the Servowarm Isthmian League and are seventh currently. Bromley's current strip is Black, White and Black. About 500 peole attend good matches. They usually play on Saturday afternoons and Tuesday evenings.
